description: The cause identified in the post relates to issues experienced during Windows feature updates, particularly with the transition to newer versions such as 23H2 and 22H2. The process of performing in-place upgrades via ISO can introduce complications as the current Windows installation effectively removes and reinstalls critical components, impacting the user’s programs and profile settings. This behavior could stem from underlying bugs in the update process or misconfigurations that interfere with the smooth installation of the new features. Users are attempting to circumvent these issues by employing 'brute force' upgrade methods, indicating that standard update processes may not adequately address the root problems. Regular monitoring and adjustments based on feedback and observed behavior in these upgrade scenarios can help mitigate related issues in future updates.
